result.execSummary:
The defendant BRANDON J TURNEY was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Repeater, Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Outstanding financial obligations are not a condition of probation & are to be paid directly to the Shawano Co Clerk of Court office within 30 days.  Debts older than 60 days will be processed for tax intercept & civil judgments.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  Payment plans available for qualifying amounts.
All financials same as noted above.

Give DNA sample.
Absolute sobriety.  No entry into any Class B licensed establishments.
No possession/use of alcohol.
AODA and followthrough.
Any other counseling determined by agent.
Letter of apology to victim through agent.
Maintain full-time employment and/or school or 5 job search contacts per week.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. BRANDON J TURNEY

records.addlTxt: Notice of Intent to Certify Debt w/WI. State Debt Collections
Shawano County DNA Proof of Submission - already on file

10:05 AM Defendant BRANDON J TURNEY in court with attorney Matthew Kolell.  Joseph J. Kaupie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea questionnaire received and reviewed.  ADA Kaupie recites the recommendation.  Defendant enters a plea of no contest to both counts.  Court advises party of their rights, gives citizenship/deportation admonition, finds factual basis, accepts defendant's waiver of their rights, the plea made, and finds guilty.  Remarks by Atty. Kaupie and Atty. Kolell.  Court makes its findings and pronounces sentence.  Appeal rights given.  

Credit for 61 days served.  Court orders 45 days applied to count 2 for TIME SERVED and remaining 16 days for count 1 if revoked.

SENTENCE:
Count 1:  withheld sentence - 2 years probation
$250.00 fine + costs = $668.00
$200.00 DNA SC and give sample.

PROBATION CONDITIONS:
45 days jail, imposed and stayed for agent's use.
Absolute sobriety.  No entry into any Class B licensed establishments.
No possession/use of alcohol.
AODA and followthrough.
Any other counseling determined by agent.
Letter of apology to victim through agent.
Maintain full-time employment and/or school or 5 job search contacts per week.
Count 2:  60 days jail, with good time (credit for 45 days served)
$250.00 fine + costs = $568.00
Letter to jail to convert cash bond to signature on 4-5-22
request for bond hearing filed by defendant - told to contact Attorney Kolell

01:09 PM Defendant BRANDON J TURNEY via Zoom with attorney Matthew Kolell.  Defendant BRANDON J TURNEY in custody.  Gregory A. Parker appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant does qualify unknown whom will represent. State asks for $500 cash bond with conditions. Atty. Kolell asks for a signature bond.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
